page.title: 01SUMMARY OF OUR AREA
page.content: Our study area lies within the Vale of Holmesdale, a broad,wide clay valley which runs east to west through Kent. To the north and south are parallel ridges of more resistant rock. The North Downs have their scarp slope to the north while the dip slope of the Ragstone Ridge is to the south. On a clay soil it is suprising to find such a variety of farming with orchards and fruit being grown together with cereals as well as pasture. One of the characteristics of our area is the way the lines of communication run east-west along the vale. These include the M20,M26 and A25 and the railway. The main settlements are Borough Green, St.Mary's Platt and Wrotham Heath. Borough Green is the largest but it only really a large village.
